entry.title: Platform update: New capabilities in Microsoft Teams meeting artifacts
entry.summary:
We’re excited to share that new Graph API capabilities for accessing recordings and transcriptions of adhoc calls have now been released on the Microsoft Teams Platform. These updates, first introduced in beta and now available in v1.0, give you access to recordings and transcripts for Teams VoIP, PSTN, and Graph API–created calls.

entry.title: Platform update: Microsoft Entra ID auth for bots is now available in group scope!
entry.summary: If you’re in a group chat and @mention the bot, you can interact with it without signing in again. The consent card appears only for the user who @mentions the bot for the first time. If the app isn’t pre-installed, user authentication depends on whether Microsoft Entra ID consent is required. In scenarios where consent is needed, the user who @mentions the bot grants permission for the requested access, allowing the bot to acquire an access token and respond within the group chat. When permissions are granted by default or trusted apps, the user can interact with the bot directly without providing consent. Drop us your feedback here!

entry.title: Platform update: Introducing Performance Report tool to evaluate web and tab apps efficiency on mobile!
entry.summary: If you’re a developer aiming to optimize the performance of your web and tab apps on mobile, the self-serve, lightweight Performance Report tool (Perf tool) is now available. This tool works on Android and iOS, providing real-time performance metrics aligned with industry standards for a superior user experience. It also empowers you to apply Teams-specific best practices directly from your mobile device, making performance evaluation and improvement easier than ever.Drop us your feedback here!

entry.title: Platform update: Precaching apps in Microsoft Teams
entry.summary:
Say goodbye to slow load times and hello to instant app loading! We're thrilled to announce that you can now precache your app in Microsoft Teams! This exciting update empowers you to opt-in your tab app to be precached in Teams, so that it loads lightning quick from the very first launch! With such blazing fast load times, users spend less time waiting and more time doing what they love.

entry.title: Platform update: Integrate your apps seamlessly with Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) and Teams-to-Teams calls
entry.summary:
You can now create personal scope apps that integrate seamlessly with PSTN and Teams-to-Teams calls. By using the right scope and context, you can build apps that effectively utilize tab type, static scope, personal context, and meeting side panels. This integration is super simple and user-friendly. You can either create a new personal tab app or update an existing one with personal scope and the right context. This makes the app more useful and gives users a richer experience during calls.

Your opinion matters. Drop us your feedback here!

entry.title: Platform update: App package editor is now available in Developer Portal to manage your app package
entry.summary:
If you're an ISV developer, you can create, manage, and customize app packages for Teams. Similar to Visual Studio Code, it enables you to seamlessly edit your app’s components, including the manifest, icons, Copilot agent files, scenes, JSON, and YAML files. You can also add a declarative agent and its related files into your app package.

Your opinion matters. Drop us your feedback here!

entry.title: Platform update: Update Bot Endpoint for GCC Compliance
entry.summary:
To ensure compliance with GCC (Government Community Cloud) requirements for US-based traffic processing, we’re sharing important guidance on bot endpoint usage.For bot developers, we recommend using the following full qualified domain names for each environment:Public traffic: https://smba.trafficmanager.net/teams/ and GCC traffic: https://smba.infra.gcc.teams.microsoft.com/
